. I'm aware of this issue. Fixing it requires a big refactoring, stay tuned.
. You have to download [Xcode](http://itunes.apple.com/app/xcode/id448457090) and run UIKit Artwork Extractor in the iOS Simulator.
. Please upgrade to the latest version, this issue is already fixed.
. They are inside **iPodUI.framework**. You can grab them on the device or by mounting the decrypted firmware dmg matching the simulator version.
. What is your iOS version? And are you running on your **device** or on the **simulator**? I get 64 images with all the toolbar items when running on an iPhone 4 **device** on iOS 5.0.1.
. This is fixed in 5324568bf1f10493865f61cddd2e0a477352ab0c.
. It is possible to extract artwork from Apple apps by mounting a decrypted iOS firmware before running the extractor. I will soon add a wiki entry to explain how you mount a decrypted iOS firmware.
. You can find instructions to [mount a decrypted iOS firmware](https://github.com/0xced/UIKit-Artwork-Extractor/wiki/Extracting-more-artwork) on the wiki.
. The `UIGlassButton` class was simply removed in iOS 5.1. If you want the glossy button feature, you have to download the iOS 5.0 simulator.

I will remove the glossy button tab when `UIGlassButton` is not available.
. Full support for iOS 6 was finalized in 95f2376f1764cad35aa4b8845544ae3d3231615b.
. Is this still the case on iOS 8?
. I just tried with Xcode 4.4.1 (4F1003) / iPhone Simulator 5.1 on Mountain Lion 10.8.1 Build 12B19 and I experienced no problem at all. Is there a log in your console that could give us more information about the problem you are experiencing?
. I just added a log if the directory creation fails in ad714db0e871af53749bb93b637eec02810c2481
. I finally added iPhone 5 support in fc252cf.
. If it’s inside the Maps app, you should be able to extract it from a iOS firmware, see [Extracting more artwork](../wiki/Extracting-more-artwork) for instructions.
. Your problem is impossible to diagnose without more information.
. iOS Artwork Extractor is not intended to be run on a device but in the simulator only, I should probably make that clear in the README.

Indeed, all images are kept in memory, there is no cell reuse and basically the whole code is crap. I’ve thought about improving all this for years but I never did it. So there is a good chance that I will not improve it in the years to come since it's working fine in the simulator. ;-)
. By default, _iOS Artwork Extractor_ searches for IPAs in `~/Music/iTunes/Mobile Applications` and `~/Music/iTunes/iTunes Media/Mobile Applications`. If your iTunes library is not there, just set the `MOBILE_APPLICATIONS_DIRECTORY` environment variable to the full path of your `Mobile Applications` directory.
. This is a duplicate of #18. iOS Artwork Extractor is not meant to be run on a device.
. It should be fixed now. If it still doesn’t work, you can set the `ARTWORK_DIRECTORY` environment variable to choose where you want to save the png files.
. This is a duplicate of #18. iOS Artwork Extractor is not meant to be run on a device.

odrobnik:
The answer is: Yes. The HIG only prohibits use of icons for a different purpose than the users expect. i.e. I once had an app rejected because I used the edit button icon for settings.
. Even though I am not aware of any change now I see the folder being created. Probably my mistake. Closing Issue.
